title: Experimental package
body:
List of changes:
* Fixed a couple of bugs in AssemblyReplacer that only applied to Apiary
* The api has changed and the json now has `request` and `responses` instead of `incoming` and `outgoing`
* The json generator had JsonDcument hardcoded on some places, adapted it so it works with apiary
* Added the replace.ToRuntime and replace.ToDesigntime where needed
* Instead of referencing the non experimental dll, the minimum needed files are reincluded in the experimental .fsproj. This was needed otherwise AssemblyReplacer wouldn't work. It still only has the Apiary provider, the extra stuff is internal
* Changed the sample to cope with the new signatures generated by json provider
* Added the new type of signature tests for Apiary also

title: Added ability to override or add headers to CSV provider
body: Can now override the headers provided in a CSV file or add them if they don't exist. Also added the ability to change the amount of rows are skipped. This is required because 1 row was always skipped which caused some problems for header less CSV's.

title: Freebase provider fetching too much data - AllowLocalQueryEvaluation=false not working?
Freebase query error when comparing to null
body:
This query works fine:

    query {
        for p in data.Commons.People.Persons do
        where (p.Name.ApproximatelyMatches "^Evelyn ")
        where (p.Gender <> null)
        select p
    }

but this one fails with an error:

    query {
        for p in data2.Commons.People.Persons do
        where (p.Name.ApproximatelyMatches "^Evelyn ")
        where (p.Gender = null)
        select p
    }

>System.Exception: unknown qualification - not a lambda - p => (p.GetPropertyByIdTyped("/people/person", "/people/person/gender") == null), Lambda, true
   at Microsoft.FSharp.Linq.RuntimeHelpers.LeafExpressionConverter.EvaluateQuotation(FSharpExpr e)
   at Microsoft.FSharp.Linq.QueryModule.EvalNonNestedInner(CanEliminate canElim, FSharpExpr queryProducingSequence)
   at Microsoft.FSharp.Linq.QueryModule.EvalNonNestedOuter(CanEliminate canElim, FSharpExpr tm)

title: Missing primitive types in freebase provider
body:
Related to #68

From http://stackoverflow.com/a/14777505/165633

>Be forewarned that there additional primitive types missing see freebase.com/inspect/type

title: Unnecessary wrapper types in json provider
body:
In https://github.com/tpetricek/FSharp.Data/blob/master/tests/FSharp.Data.Tests/JsonProvider.Tests.fs#L38

`prov.[0].A.Number` is an int option. Either `prov.[0].A` should directly be an int option, or `prov.[0].Number` should be an int instead of an int option.

Before https://github.com/tpetricek/FSharp.Data/commit/fa0a913e0f553dbebb53b3410e7a39aa810e0839 it was the first option, did you change it intentionally?

title: Fix the "Can access the first 10 amino acids" test
body: The test seems to be failing on my machine. Perhaps the Freebase structure has changed somehow?

title: Optional Strings in Json/Xml providers
body:
In the Json and Xml providers, does it make sense to generate string option? Shouldn't we just generate string like in the csv provider?

E.g., before https://github.com/tpetricek/FSharp.Data/commit/fa0a913e0f553dbebb53b3410e7a39aa810e0839, instead of tweet.Text.Value we could use tweet.Text in here:
 https://github.com/tpetricek/FSharp.Data/blob/master/samples/JsonProvider.fsx#L187

title: Add FunScript demo
body: In the demos solution, in addition to Silverlight, Windows 8 and Windows Phone would be nice to have also a FunScript project. If we add ReflectedDefinition to the portable library maybe we could even reuse it and just add the mappings?

title: CSV Type provider should have a GetColumn(columnName:string) method for dynamic lookup
body:
From https://github.com/fsharp/fsharpx/issues/121

>Noticed during the F# progressive tutorials that the CSV provider would benefit from a GetCoumn(columnName:string) method that does dynamic lookup by name instead of static binding. This is a normal design pattern for a type provider.

>(This was based on using @tomasp's version of the type provider)

>Also GetColumnNames etc. for dynamic access to the schema

title: add some column descriptors (for code sprint)
body: we could expose the inferred types of columns at the TP level (and even add additional information like mean, variance for numeric types, 10 first options cases etc... )

title: add a option for header or not in Csvprovider (for code sprint)
body:
when there is no header, it takes the first data row as of now. 
we can add names by hand to the csv or generate generic names like col0, ..

title: publish a new nuget (keep for code sprint)
Support XSD in XmlProvider
Support mixed separators in CsvProvider?
body:
I just saw a file that is classified as tab separated values, but in which the first column is a collection of 5 values comma separated :/

This was a random file from the EU open data, but I wonder if this is common:
http://open-data.europa.eu/open-data/data/dataset/00YYPa7FUadFAd4HH4quTw/resource/f6884ab7-edb7-46fa-a61b-ee0b0c0cb723

title: Allow to specify the NA string in CSV provider
body: In some datasets it's ":"

title: Use a smarter default separator for CSVProvider
body:
If the sample file/url ends with tsv, use \t as the default separator if nothing was specified.
We could also look at the header row and infer it in case there isn't any comma

title: Use AddDefinitionLocation in the type providers when using a file in the sample
body:
So when pressing F12 in VisualStudio on a generated property, it opens up the sample csv/xml/json in the right place.
See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-gb/library/hh361034.aspx for an example

title: Consider renaming CsvProvider
body:
I know this suggestion is a little bold, but thinking about it, CsvProvider currently works not only with just csv files but also with tab separated files, or any other similar textual format, and in the future it might well support more formats of tabular data (like xls/xlsx, hdf5/netCDF4, .rdata, .mat, etc...), either directly or maybe as plugins (I have some ideas about how to make that work without changing the api or creating dependencies...). But the inference and generation of typed properties is the same between all the formats.
Both the R tools and the several Python libraries that work with all those kind of files are usually called read.table or read_table (even though they have overloads called read.csv or read_csv that the only thing they do is to set the default separator to ',')
Do you think renaming CsvProvider to TabularDataProvider would be a good idea? Or are people expecting that name and we can always make the same type provider available under other additional names (like we do with freebase and worldbank that have two versions each)?

title: Yahoo Finance Type Provider
body:
I'm not sure if this fits within FSharp.Data or not, but it does seem like a fairly common use case. We already use yahoo data in the CSV samples, but like WorldBank, where we can use the Json TP, having a dedicated TP is much better.

Some links with info on the API:
http://code.google.com/p/yahoo-finance-managed/wiki/CSVAPI
http://developer.yahoo.com/yql/
http://www.jarloo.com/yahoo-stock-symbol-lookup/

title: NameUtils improvements
body:
* When we find a field like "Foo%", instead of generating "Foo", generate "FooPct" or "FooPercentage"

* When we find something like "Foo&Bar", instead of generating "FooBar" generate "FooAndBar"

* When we find something like "Foo@Bar", instead of generating "FooBar" generate "FooAtBar"

title: Generate enums in csv type provider
body: If a column is infered as string, and there are many repeated values, it's probably an enumeration, so we could generate an enum. If the inference geets it wrong, we could always override (#19). We could use something like (number of distinct values / number of rows) < 0.2 to trigger this

title: Write API
body: See https://github.com/fsharp/fsharpx/issues/196

title: Fix System.Xml.Linq reference in portable library for Silverlight
body: If not possible

title: Fix enableUriSlashes for Portable version
version of fsharpchart is not the current one from nuget
body: version the packages config + some specific build targets for downloading them ?

title: Allow overriding the schema in the CSV provider
body:
Two alternatives:

* Type provider parameter like in in TryFSharp.org:

        type csvType = CsvFile<file, Schema = "date,float,float,float,float,int,float">

* Allow to specify the type in the header title within braces, like we already allow for units

        Column1 (m), Column1 (float), Column2 (float<m>)

title: Add async loading
body:
When reading CSV, XML or JSON from the web, it should be possible to read the data asynchronously.

 * For XML and JSON, we read the entire file before processing, so this should be just a simple `AsyncLoad` method.
 * For CSV, it would be nice to use some sort of async enumerator so that we can read the data asynchronously on demand.

title: Will FSharp.Data work with mono on a Mac?
body: Does the type providers work with mono on Mac? I am using visual studio on Windows right now but would like to switch to Mac if possible.

title: Add FsCharts to the nuget package
body:
Hi,

since nearly all of the samples are using FsChart it would be cool it this could become part of the nuget package. This would allow me to write easier tutorials for my Dynamics NAV friends.

Cheers,
Steffen
